trails.name: Monarch Crest - IMBA EPIC
trails.summary: One of Colorado's top 5 epic rides - classic high-altitude riding in the Rockies!

trails.name: 401 Trail Loop
trails.summary: The Crested Butte mega classic! High alpine meadows with unbeatable views.

trails.name: Doctor Park
trails.summary: A local favorite with a tough grind of a climb, then fast, flowy singletrack as a reward.

trails.name: Teocalli Ridge Loop
trails.summary: A tough climb, great views, and a fun, long downhill

trails.name: Strand Hill
trails.summary: One of the best rides in the valley.

trails.name: Reno/Flag/Bear/Deadman's Gulch
trails.summary: A Crested Butte classic with 3 distinct uphills and 3 distinct downhills

trails.name: Snodgrass, Lupine, Lower Loop Combo
trails.summary: A classic intermediate loop close to town.

trails.name: Rim Trail Loop
trails.summary: Great singletrack ride with awesome views!

trails.name: Seize the Cheese
trails.summary: A sample ride of some of the most scenic, buff, and fun singletrack you'll ever ride.

trails.name: Colorado Trail: Copper Mountain to Searle Pass
trails.summary: A spectacular segment of the Colorado trail in a breathtaking alpine setting topping out at 12,044'!
trails.conditionDetails: Some slick spots and snow patches but nothing notable

trails.name: Snodgrass Out and Back
trails.summary: A short but enjoyable singletrack cruise close to Crested Butte.

trails.name: Hartman Rocks
trails.summary: A great tour of the Hartman Rocks area; challenge, flow, and exposure in a beautiful setting.

trails.name: Forest Hollow and Boy Scout Loop
trails.summary: A beautiful ride that covers a variety of terrain and scenery along the rim of Glenwood Canyon.

trails.name: Monarch to Fooses Creek
trails.summary: Beautiful views on the start to the Monarch Crest trail, then fun, fast descending on Fooses Creek.
trails.conditionDetails: Mostly Dry - the usual muddy spots

trails.name: Twin Lakes Trail
trails.summary: A nice trail around beautiful Twin Lakes.
trails.conditionDetails: Dry - You have to cross the river and several creeks on Willow Creek Road

trails.name: Canyon Creek Loop
trails.summary: A grueling road climb up to tree line then a big hike-a-bike followed by tasteful descending.
trails.conditionDetails: Mostly Dry, Fallen Trees - The snow is all gone. Minimal mud. One fallen tree. Great shape! All the rocks are still there of course.

trails.name: Smuggler-Hunter-VanHorn-Hobbit-Secret-Sunnyside Loop Ride
trails.summary: A grand tour combining many of Aspen's best backyard singletrack trails.

trails.name: CDT Alpine Tunnel
trails.summary: Historic high alpine riding.
trails.conditionDetails: Some Mud - the train trail is wet in some places, but rideable. there are several snow fields above treeline.

trails.name: Buena Vista Singletrack Loop
trails.summary: A tour of a bunch of Buena Vista singletrack.

trails.name: Dirty Copper Triangle
trails.summary: Dirt version of the Copper Triangle

trails.name: Red Hill Loop
trails.summary: A highly entertaining set of singletrack trails rideable right from the town of Carbondale.
trails.conditionDetails: Looks like the parking area is closed

trails.name: The Snowmass Loop
trails.summary: This grand loop tour takes in many of Snowmass' best modern and classic singletrack trails.

trails.name: Glassier - Buckhorn Loop
trails.summary: A fantastic lollipop in the mid-valley that mixes a little bike path with lots of flowy singletrack.

trails.name: Crystal Peak, Star Pass, Hunters Creek Loop
trails.summary: High alpine riding, fast flowy downhill and fantastic scenery.

trails.name: Sky Mountain Park Loop
trails.summary: A view-filled tour from Aspen to Snowmass and back, via Sky Mountain Park.

trails.name: Aspen Snowmass Mega Loop
trails.summary: Singletrack overload, technical classics, modern flow, never-ending views. A worthy and rewarding ride to remember!

trails.name: Snowmass Trails to Aspen Shuttle Ride
trails.summary: A tour of Snowmass ski area singletrack that continues to Aspen via the classic Government Trail.

trails.name: Green Lake Trail
trails.summary: One of the best out and back rides in Crested Butte.

trails.name: The Up 'N' Over AKA Rock Bottom Ranch AKA Crown Cruise
trails.summary: A local's favorite loop that starts and ends on the Rio Grande Trail and offers up a taste of Prince Creek.

trails.name: Power of Four - Old Course
trails.summary: One of three separate Power of 4 races - a premier endurance series in the Aspen Snowmass mountains.

trails.name: Prince Creek Quickie
trails.summary: A quick loop that gives you a full taste of the Prince Creek Trail system.

trails.name: Winter Ride: Big Perm
trails.summary: A groomed and flowy singletrack winter trail through the lodgepole forest for fatbikes.

trails.name: Monarch Crest to Green's
trails.summary: A great combination of the scenic Continental Divide with a burly, technical descent.
trails.conditionDetails: Mostly Dry, Fallen Trees: Couple of snowbanks on the actual Crest (stay on trail!) at Greens Creek junction (this can change with a bit of wind).

trails.name: Frisco 20 Loop
trails.summary: A scenic, simple, mixed-surface ride that's fun on a variety of bike types.

trails.name: Lincoln Creek Road to Ruby Ghost Town
trails.summary: A classic ride with big mountain views, the turn around is near a ghost town just above tree line.

trails.name: Dyke Trail Loop
trails.summary: A Crested Butte classic with a bit of everything.
trails.conditionDetails: muddy smelly small water pits otherwise ripping!

trails.name: 409s and Point Lookout Loop
trails.summary: Great views, a fun, moderately technical descent and a bonus descent on Strand.

trails.name: Jumbo Ridge Loop
trails.summary: The classic big loop on Jumbo and a classic Colorado climb followed by a long descent that is as good as it gets.

trails.name: Deer Creek Loop
trails.summary: A long cross-country ride with stellar views and wildflowers.

trails.name: The Hartman Rocks Big Loop
trails.summary: A grand tour of a unique and iconic Colorado Trail system; it's flow-gnar fun!

trails.name: Smuggler Hunter Creek loop  ride
trails.summary: Aspen's closest singletrack network accessed by climbing up the popular Smuggler Mt. Road.

trails.name: Buttermilk Bowls Loop
trails.summary: A climb up Buttermilk Mt. that descends back to Tiehack via Buttermilk Bowls and Government Trail.

trails.name: Tin Cup Pass Loop
trails.summary: A bikepacking route in the Collegiate Range.
trails.conditionDetails: Dry - Still a little snow but it will melt soon

trails.name: Mt Princeton Hot Springs - Little Brown's Creek Loop
trails.summary: A big loop on Mt Antero, from Mt Princeton Hot Springs, with an epic descent down Little Browns Creek Trail #1430

trails.name: Innie Outie
trails.summary: A challenging lollipop in the mid-valley with significant climbs that reward with ripping descents.

trails.name: Monarch Crest to Agate Creek Loop
trails.summary: A long dirt road climb to access the classic Monarch Crest Trail and a great technical descent.
trails.conditionDetails: Mostly Dry, Fallen Trees: Couple of snowbanks on the actual Crest (stay on trail!) at Greens Creek junction (this can change with a bit of wind).

trails.name: Sugarloaf Lollipop
trails.summary: A lung-busting climb to a stellar descent.
trails.conditionDetails: Mostly Dry, Some Mud, Fallen Trees

trails.name: CT - Camp Hale to Holy Cross Wilderness
trails.summary: XC ride on the Colorado Trail from Camp Hale via Tennessee Pass to Holy Cross Wilderness boundary.

trails.name: Hwy 285/Mears Junction - CR 47YY/Silver Creek Rd - Rainbow Trail Loop
trails.summary: Another option to enjoy this section of the Rainbow Trail, after an easy ride up the road.

trails.name: Crane Park to Camp Hale Loop
trails.summary: A fantastic, singletrack loop ride from the Tennessee Pass area to Camp Hale.

trails.name: Aberdeen Loop
trails.summary: A longer, more remote, experience out at Hartman Rocks.

trails.name: Pipeline to Twin Lakes Loop
trails.summary: A great loop on the Colorado Trail including the Collegiate West section around Twin Lakes.

trails.name: Canyon Creek Megacalorie
trails.summary: If the normal Canyon Creek Trail loop isn't hard enough, this point-to-point option is for you.
trails.conditionDetails: Snowy: Snow and large Snow Banks until late June probably.

trails.name: Crossroads Trails: Hotchkiss Colorado Recreation Center and Highschool
trails.summary: These trails have a combination of smooth flowing singletrack that range from green to black with built in features.

trails.name: Aspen Fat Bike Loop
trails.summary: Winter-only loop (and sub-loops) combines groomed singletrack, nordic trails, and some plowed paths near downtown Aspen.

trails.name: Raggeds Shuttle
trails.summary: A classic backcountry adventure route with stunning scenery and challenging terrain.

trails.name: Evans Loop
trails.summary: An easy loop that is fun for the whole family.

trails.name: MJ Loop
trails.summary: A great 75-minute ride on the lower part of the mountain. A rolling climb and a lot of fast, flowing singletrack.

trails.name: Dennis Weaver Memorial Park
trails.summary: A simple set of singletrack loops that provide a great cool-down after riding the other RAT trails.

trails.name: Eagle Backcountry Tour
trails.summary: An amazing dirt road tour of Eagle's backcountry.

trails.name: Coal Creek to Thompson Link Up
trails.summary: A real deal backcountry loop that samples some of the best trails in the Coal Creek and Thompson Divide area.

trails.name: Tour of Babbish
trails.summary: Glorious riding through old growth aspen forest.

trails.name: Cerro Summit Trail System
trails.summary: A nice little trail system right off of Highway 50 at Cerro Summit.

trails.name: Montrose Big Loop
trails.summary: A big loop with 10 miles of downhill singletrack, rideable from Montrose.

trails.name: Red Hill Sampler
trails.summary: Very fun network but the climb up could be easier!
trails.conditionDetails: Looks like the parking area is closed

trails.name: Lake Ridge Loop
trails.summary: This creates a great loop in the Thompson Divide area with beautiful views and low car traffic.

trails.name: Signal Peak Loop
trails.summary: Longer ride which includes most of the singletrack trails in the Signal Peak area.

trails.name: Fisher Creek Loop
trails.summary: A smooth, steep climb to a ripping old doubletrack road that's slowly turning into singletrack.

trails.name: Sunset Rocks
trails.summary: Technical desert riding with a few short climbs and quick descents.

trails.name: Rendezvous Lift Out-and-Back
trails.summary: A service road climb to the top of Rendezvous Ski Lift, followed by a quick ride down.

trails.name: marble to schofield
trails.summary: top of dans hill to schofield through devil's punch bowl

trails.name: Waterfall Cutoff Loop
trails.summary: A nice singletrack loop in the Cement Creek area.

trails.name: Trail Riders Trail #401
trails.summary: The bread and butter of 401 Trail Loop - alpine singletrack at its best.

trails.name: Vitamin B
trails.summary: Amazing views, fast flow, slow tech, ledge drops. For expert riders, this trail has got it all!
trails.conditionDetails: Dry - Great conditions. Gnarly tech. Didn't get the notice this was double black when the shop guy recommended it. Loved it!

trails.name: Lupine 1
trails.summary: Short but sweet, and one of the valley's newest trails.

trails.name: Doctor Park Trail
trails.summary: A rowdy and ever-changing trail that's well worth the brutal Doctor Gulch climb.

trails.name: Deadline Trail
trails.summary: Bike optimized downhill recommended flow style trail with great bermed turns and tons of fun jumps.

trails.name: Father of Ginormous
trails.summary: A raw version of Ginormous with bigger turns and it's longer, meaning more fun for you.

trails.name: Seven Star Trail
trails.summary: A trail with big views and fast flow, a new highlight for the Snowmass area trail system!

trails.name: Green's Creek
trails.summary: A technical rider's escape from the traditional Monarch Crest ride.

trails.name: Gunsight Connector
trails.summary: Another downhill option in the Slate River drainage.

trails.name: Tom Blake
trails.summary: Smooth intermediate singletrack.

trails.name: Monarch Crest Trail
trails.summary: A classic Colorado high-country ridge run with stunning views

trails.name: Valhalla Trail
trails.summary: Advanced Downhill Flow and Jump Trail.

trails.name: Airline Trail
trails.summary: Bike-specific flow style trail with great berm turns, big views, perfect grades for both up & down.

trails.name: Wheeler Trail
trails.summary: Stunning alpine scenery on extremely steep singletrack.
trails.conditionDetails: To the guy that I talked to at the aqueduct road gate. Good to go all the way to copper!! Only 2 manageable snow drifts...

trails.name: French Press
trails.summary: Super fast flow, massive high speed berms, sweet views, and fun boardwalk bridges. A quick favorite for many.

trails.name: Government Trail
trails.summary: This classic trail is a must for any serious rider.  Enjoy during fall colors for best experience.

trails.name: Rattlesnake
trails.summary: Fun and technical.

trails.name: Rim Trail
trails.summary: A good climb to amazing views on smooth intermediate singletrack.

trails.name: Ginormous
trails.summary: An amazingly fun trail down a moderate declining wash with tons of great features to have fun on!

trails.name: Avery
trails.summary: A rocky and sometimes steep descent.

trails.name: Starvation Creek
trails.summary: Primitive and steep singletrack that offers a shorter option than the traditional 'Crest experience.

trails.name: Silver Creek Trail
trails.summary: A steep, rocky, loose and narrow section of the Monarch Crest ride.
trails.conditionDetails: be on the lookout for fallen trees as there are many dead ones (beetle kill)

trails.name: Lower Loop
trails.summary: Fast singletrack close to town - a great beginner ride.

trails.name: Turquoise Lake Singletrack
trails.summary: A beautiful ride next to one of the largest bodies of water in Colorado!

trails.name: Teocalli Ridge Trail #557
trails.summary: A tough climb leading to great views and a fun, long downhill.
trails.conditionDetails: Dry - Perfect condition but that doesn't make it any more enjoyable :)

trails.name: Blue Ribbon
trails.summary: A very technical descent that could put a smile on your face! The top half was re-routed in 2017 to be more rideable

trails.name: Teaser
trails.summary: Fast, smooth, and flowy.

trails.name: Sunnyside Trail
trails.summary: One of Aspen's premier classic trails, offering big views and challenging riding.
trails.conditionDetails: Snowy, Fallen Trees - the west side is good to go all the way until it goes back into the shaded trees other than a few fallen trees. The section that connects with secret Jedi is very snowy still and it is very snowy to the four corner junction.

trails.name: Ratical
trails.summary: Needs Adoption

trails.name: Luge
trails.summary: A super fast trail with only mild tech.
trails.conditionDetails: Some closed trails must pedal or shuttle no lift access.

trails.name: Canyon Creek Trail
trails.summary: A great descent which starts well above treeline and drops into great forest singletrack.

trails.name: Verde
trails.summary: A great beginner flow trail designed by gravity logic.

trails.name: Strand Hill
trails.summary: A fun, fast, intermediate descent through meadows and aspens.
trails.conditionDetails:
Dry - There is a new bridge at the beginning of Canal trail.
Gorgeous ride

trails.name: Animal Crackers
trails.summary: A Snowmass Bike Park downhill trail.

trails.name: CT - Segment 11: Mount Massive to Clear Creek
trails.summary: Needs Summary

trails.name: CT - Segment 8: Copper Mountain to Tennessee Pass
trails.summary: An awesome, unique high alpine ride to over 12,000 ft but a steep and loose finish.

trails.name: South Mount Elbert Trail #1481
trails.summary: This trail is in the process of being rebuilt, so hopefully there will be less hike-a-bike in the future!

trails.name: Trail 403
trails.summary: Short and technical with great views.
trails.conditionDetails: Dry, Some Mud - Only very minor mud in just a few places.

trails.name: Mill Creek
trails.summary: One of the best desents in the RFV.

trails.name: Collarbone Alley
trails.summary: One of the best descent options back to the main parking area.

trails.name: Elk Traverse
trails.summary: A technical and challenging route that connects you with the North and Sage Loops.

trails.name: Snodgrass Trail #590
trails.summary: Start from either trailhead to meander through aspens and meadows along the south side of Snodgrass Mountain.

trails.name: Rainbow Trail #1336: Silver Creek to Mears Junction Hwy 285
trails.summary: A great - but tough - singletrack finish to the Monarch Crest, or a slightly easier ride as part of a loop.

trails.name: The Big Cheese
trails.summary: A model climbing trail with, with several great descending options as your reward.

trails.name: Viking
trails.summary: A rerouted Easy Rider trail provides great intermediate flow with many challenging advanced moments

trails.name: Little Browns Creek Trail #1430
trails.summary: A long, steep descent that drops 3000' all in one shot. Keep going on the CT as it drops 4000'.

trails.name: Shadyside Trail
trails.summary: Great singletrack riding on the north side of Red Mt.

trails.name: Rat Trap
trails.summary: Just about the most fun you can have on two wheels...

trails.name: Roller Coaster
trails.summary: A fun, twisty roller coaster, as the name implies.

trails.name: Happy Hour
trails.summary: Downhill access from Lower Westside to Upper Loop.
trails.conditionDetails: Some closed trails must pedal or shuttle no lift access.

trails.name: Hot Dogger
trails.summary: An easy, fast and flowing trail from the top of the Red Lady lift.
trails.conditionDetails: Signs about 1/3 of way down say the trail is closed but there was not sign at the top mentioning this.

trails.name: Upper Lower Loop
trails.summary: A fun alternative to lower loop with some great downhill.

trails.name: Bear Creek
trails.summary: A steady climb to get to a seemingly never ending downhill.

trails.name: Richmond Ridge Road
trails.summary: A classic alpine forested ridge road with stunning views of the Elk Mountains.

trails.name: Vapor Trail
trails.summary: Downhill-only trail from the top of the Elk Camp Chair to the Elk Camp Gondola.

trails.name: Frequency
trails.summary: Lots of jumps, not much tech.
trails.conditionDetails: Some closed trails must pedal or shuttle no lift access.

trails.name: Psycho Rocks
trails.summary: Ramps and rock gardens.

trails.name: Dyke Trail
trails.summary: A Crested Butte classic with a bit of everything

trails.name: CT - Segment 9 - 10 Detour: Holy Cross/Mount Massive Wilderness Bypass
trails.summary: A portion of the Colorado Trail that detours around the Holy Cross/Mt. Massive Wilderness.

trails.name: Captain Jack
trails.summary: A steep trail featuring tough rock gardens.

trails.name: Deer Creek Trail
trails.summary: Fairly long ride with some leg burning climbs and lots of scenery.

trails.name: Chicken Wing
trails.summary: Needs Summary

trails.name: Colorado 14ers Loop: Segment 1 - Salida to Leadville
trails.summary: The western half of the route including the Colorado Trail and some big summits.

trails.name: Wood's Trail
trails.summary: A fast descent with a bit of everything.

trails.name: Segment 6: Nucla to Durango
trails.summary: A route from the desert through the San Juan Mountains on dirt roads, 4x4 tracks, and classic alpine singletrack.

trails.name: CT: Upper Twin Lakes Section
trails.summary: Gorgeous singletrack along the lake and through historic Interlaken Resort remains.

trails.name: Lupin 2
trails.summary: Needs Summary

trails.name: Colorado 14ers Loop: Segment 2 - Leadville to Salida
trails.summary: The eastern half of this loop: more 14ers, seldom-ridden backcountry singletrack, and gravel roads back to Salida.

trails.name: Cemetery Trail
trails.summary: A relatively wide, flat, and well-maintained dirt road.

trails.name: North Face Bypass
trails.summary: A great section of singletrack on the Leadville Trail 100 course.

trails.name: 2Bucks
trails.summary: This short fast trail blazes down through the trees.

trails.name: West South Rim
trails.summary: This new addition to the South Rim trail casually winds its way around the southern most side of Signal Peak.

trails.name: Squeeker
trails.summary: Needs Summary

trails.name: Cozyline Trail
trails.summary: New trail with great flowing sections that can be enjoyed both up and down.

trails.name: Josho's
trails.summary: A rip roaring, fast and flowy descent.

trails.name: Golddigger
trails.summary: A flowy trail through the aspens.

trails.name: Three Gulch Trail
trails.summary: A technical, fun, and challenging grunt of a climb into the generally flowy Red Hill trails.

trails.name: Tunnel Lake Trail
trails.summary: High alpine singletrack that is almost entirely above treeline.

trails.name: CT - Segment 14: Chalk Creek to US-50
trails.summary: Beautiful alpine singletrack with a mixture of big climbs and fun descents.

trails.name: Ridge of Doom
trails.summary: Wicked fast downhill run. You lose a lot of hard-earned vertical very fast on this descent but you won't regret it.

trails.name: Ironedge Trail #1873
trails.summary: A fun singletrack descent from the Peter Estin Hut.

trails.name: Hunters Creek
trails.summary: A fun descent option in the Cement Creek area.

trails.name: Upper Loop
trails.summary: A short trail with a few technical spots - makes a great connector.
trails.conditionDetails: Mostly Dry, Some Mud - A little mud, but you can stay on trail and still ride around.

trails.name: The Ridge
trails.summary: Fun and technical with great views.

trails.name: Karni Mata Loop
trails.summary: A lollipop trail with some relatively easy climbing and relatively amazing views.

trails.name: Broken Boyfriend (6032A)
trails.summary: The most technical trail in BV end to end.

trails.name: The Notch
trails.summary: A steep descent on slickrock and dirt back to the main parking area.

trails.name: Upper Cement Creek Trail
trails.summary: Beginner singletrack that parallels Cement Creek Road.

trails.name: Hobbit Trail
trails.summary: A long time local's favorite, this trail alternates fast flow and tight turns for hoots and smiles.

trails.name: Lower Monte Carlo
trails.summary: Descending-only singletrack to finish off your Prince Creek ride!

trails.name: Trail 400 (Star Pass)
trails.summary: A stellar high alpine ride in the Brush Creek area.
trails.conditionDetails: Some Mud: 400 is clear.  However, getting there via Star Pass is really tough with lots of snow and cornice on 583 up to Star Pass.

trails.name: Red Table Trail
trails.summary: A great secluded singletrack mostly in the trees that ends with an incredible view of Mt. Sopris.

trails.name: Rattus Maximus
trails.summary: A fantastic climb trail to the top of the system or ride half way up if you want a shorter loop.

trails.name: McKenzie Gulch Trail #1869
trails.summary: A fast descent through the aspens.

trails.name: East Rim Trail
trails.summary: A scenic trail through upper Walsh's & Kristi's ski runs to start your descent of Aspen Mountain.

trails.name: North Porcupine
trails.summary: North Porcupine is a combination of sage fields and small wooded areas, with short, punchy climbs.

trails.name: Strand Bonus
trails.summary: Fun singletrack to add to a Strand Hill ride.

trails.name: Vasten Trail
trails.summary: Cross country tour in the middle of the Crown, adding mileage to ride on the Buckhorn Traverse.

trails.name: Northside Loop
trails.summary: Starts with a long rocky climb, middle is filled with fast fields, and ends with a punchy climb.

trails.name: Lorax Trail
trails.summary: Rides great as a rolling out-and-back with rewarding rocky tech moments.

trails.name: Skull Bucket Trail
trails.summary: Difficult to find, great views on high traverse, and excellent high speed natural gully descending.

trails.name: Discovery Trail
trails.summary: A wide, smooth, and easy climbing-only trail that rewards riders with big views the higher you climb.

trails.name: Cross Mountain Trail
trails.summary: A challenging, rocky, rolling trail traversing the middle section of Snowmass Mt. ski area.

trails.name: Secret-Jedi trail
trails.summary: Sweet high quality singletrack with some gentle climbing connecting 4 Corners to Sunnyside trail.

trails.name: Scotty's Trail
trails.summary: A steep and exhilarating singletrack down the ski terrain of Aspen Mountain.

trails.name: Viewline Trail
trails.summary: Singletrack access to Sky Mountain Park from Snowmass

trails.name: Butterline
trails.summary: An easy, modern, bike-optimized trail that follows gentle grades to connect towards Sky Mt. Park.

trails.name: CT - Segment 13 - Cottonwood Pass Rd to Chalk Creek
trails.summary: Alpine singletrack with a mixture of easier flow and steep technical trail.

trails.name: Deadman Gulch
trails.summary: A leg burner climb near the apex and a steep 1000ft descent.

trails.name: Bambi's
trails.summary: A great downhill with access to trails south of Road 3550 (Powerline Road).

trails.name: Splinter
trails.summary: Adopt me, please!

trails.name: Faerie Trail
trails.summary: An enjoyable meander through the woods with a bit of gentle climbing, and some flowy descending.

trails.name: Skill Saw (Lower Creek Side)
trails.summary: Great flow through scrub oak and aspens, offering one the chance to let it go a little.

trails.name: Trail 583 (Crystal Peak)
trails.summary: Non-motorized singletrack accessing Trail 400 (Star Pass) from Cement Creek.
trails.conditionDetails: Snowy: 6/20: clear up to 582.1A junction, but above up to Star Pass was ~50% postholing;  cornice to climb thru at top. 400 clear.

trails.name: Beck's
trails.summary: Fast, flowy, easy downhill.

trails.name: Pearl Pass Road #738
trails.summary: An absolute high alpine classic, well-known for its role in mountain bike history.

trails.name: Hunter Creek Trail
trails.summary: Great views, fast open sections, and fun technical sections add up to provide really great riding!

trails.name: Red Tail
trails.summary: An intermediate ride down Copper Mountain.

trails.name: Free Fall
trails.summary: If you're looking for spicy steeps, drops, and rock rolls, look no farther. Experts only.

trails.name: Para Me Y Para Te Trail
trails.summary: A very rocky and loose trail above the town of Crested Butte.
trails.conditionDetails: Mostly Dry, Some Mud - A snow patch or two and some typical mud. Rest is a go!

trails.name: Plumber's Crack
trails.summary: This trail is the heart of the lower trails on Jumbo and stretches from CC’s Corner to Jumbo Ridge.

trails.name: Fanny Hill Trail
trails.summary: Singletrack with nice berms that connects Snowmass Village Mall to Base Village.

trails.name: Centipede
trails.summary: This is a multidirectional trail that can be used as an alternative descent from Upsie Daisy or to descend Downspout.

trails.name: Vail Pass to Copper Bike Path
trails.summary: A great tourist shuttle ride, or a great workout.

trails.name: Wheelers Way
trails.summary: A great loop with awesome descents in either direction.

trails.name: Copper to Frisco Bike Path
trails.summary: An excellent component of the Summit County Recreation Path.

trails.name: Upper Upper Loop
trails.summary: A steep technical uphill and a fast steep descent.
